description: Manage storage classes of Arc Kubernetes clusters.

commands.name: az k8s-runtime storage-class create
commands.syntax:
az k8s-runtime storage-class create --resource-uri
                                    --storage-class-name
                                    [--access-modes]
                                    [--allow-volume-expansion {Allow, Disallow}]
                                    [--data-resilience {DataResilient, NotDataResilient}]
                                    [--failover-speed {Fast, NotAvailable, Slow, Super}]
                                    [--limitations]
                                    [--mount-options]
                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                    [--performance {Basic, Premium, Standard, Ultra, Undefined}]
                                    [--priority]
                                    [--provisioner]
                                    [--type-properties]
                                    [--volume-binding-mode {Immediate, WaitForFirstConsumer}]
examples: az k8s-runtime storage-class create --resource-uri subscriptions/00000000-1111-2222-3333-444444444444/resourceGroups/example/providers/Microsoft.Kubernetes/connectedClusters/cluster1 --storage-class-name blobsc --type-properties blob.azure-storage-account-key=accountkey blob.azure-storage-account-name=accountname

commands.name: az k8s-runtime storage-class delete
commands.syntax:
az k8s-runtime storage-class delete --resource-uri
                                    --storage-class-name
                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                    [--yes]

commands.name: az k8s-runtime storage-class disable
commands.summary: Disable storage class service in a connected cluster.

commands.name: az k8s-runtime storage-class enable
commands.summary: Enable storage class service in a connected cluster.

commands.name: az k8s-runtime storage-class update
commands.syntax:
az k8s-runtime storage-class update --resource-uri
                                    --storage-class-name
                                    [--access-modes]
                                    [--allow-volume-expansion {Allow, Disallow}]
                                    [--data-resilience {DataResilient, NotDataResilient}]
                                    [--failover-speed {Fast, NotAvailable, Slow, Super}]
                                    [--limitations]
                                    [--mount-options]
                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                    [--performance {Basic, Premium, Standard, Ultra, Undefined}]
                                    [--priority]
                                    [--type-properties]
examples: az k8s-runtime storage-class update --resource-uri subscriptions/00000000-1111-2222-3333-444444444444/resourceGroups/example/providers/Microsoft.Kubernetes/connectedClusters/cluster1 --storage-class-name blobsc --type-properties azure-storage-account-key=accountkey azure-storage-account-name=accountname

commands.name: az k8s-runtime storage-class wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
